CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 1, 1955, pg. 3, reads: "Joining NAACP - Workers at the Eagle Linen Supply Company, 141 Fortieth Street, signed for membership in National Association for the Advancement of Colored People after deciding that there are still many problems to overcome before equal rights for everybody is a fact. Some of the workers who signed up for NAACP membership Tuesday during a lunch hour period are, left to right: Minnie Epps, 7714 Baxter Street; Margaret Mirody, 2336 McCook Street; Lloyd Bluett, 323 Burrows Street; Bernice Wilborn, 3433 Mulberry Way, and Garland H. Lockett, 3231 Penn Avenue. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men, including Minnie Epps, Margaret Mirody, Lloyd Bluett, Bernice Wilborn, and Garland H. Lockett signing up for NAACP membership outside of Eagle Linen Supply Company, 141 40th Street, Lawrenceville
